Package io

Class Input

java.lang.Object
io.Input
public class Input
extends java.lang.Object
This class implements receiving input from Keyboard and mouse

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Input()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWKeyCallback getKeyboard()
    Getter, this function returns the glfw callback for the keyboard
    static org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWMouseButtonCallback getMbtn()
    Getter, this function returns the glfw callback for the mouse buttons
    static org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWCursorPosCallback getMouse()
    Getter, returns the glfw callback for the mouse
    static Vector2f getMousePos()
    Getter, this function returns the x and y coordinates of the mouse on the screen
    static void init()
    This function initializes the Input class
    static boolean isKeyDown​(int key)
    This function checks if a key is being held down, returns true if it is, false if not
    static boolean isKeyPressed​(int key)
    This function checks if a key is pressed, it returns true if it is, false else
    static boolean isKeyUp​(int key)
    This function checks if a key was released, returns true if it is, false if not
    static boolean isMouseDown​(int btn)
    This function checks if a mouse button is being held down, returns true if it is, false if not
    static boolean isMousePressed​(int btn)
    This function checks if a mouse button is pressed, it returns true if it is, false else
    static boolean isMouseUp​(int btn)
    This function checks if a mouse button was released, returns true if it is, false if not
    static void resetKeyboard()
    This function resets all the keyboard buttons and sets them to -1
    static void resetMouse()
    This function resets all the mouse buttons and sets them to -1
    static void update()
    This function resets both the keyboard keys and the mouse buttons

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • init

      public static void init()
      This function initializes the Input class

    • isKeyPressed

      public static boolean isKeyPressed​(int key)
      This function checks if a key is pressed, it returns true if it is, false else
      Parameters:
      key - integer number assigned to a keyboard key in glfw
      Returns:
      true if key is pressed, false else

    • isKeyDown

      public static boolean isKeyDown​(int key)
      This function checks if a key is being held down, returns true if it is, false if not
      Parameters:
      key - integer number assigned to a keyboard key in glfw
      Returns:
      true if key is held down, false else

    • isKeyUp

      public static boolean isKeyUp​(int key)
      This function checks if a key was released, returns true if it is, false if not
      Parameters:
      key - integer number assigned to a keyboard key in glfw
      Returns:
      true if key was released, false else

    • isMousePressed

      public static boolean isMousePressed​(int btn)
      This function checks if a mouse button is pressed, it returns true if it is, false else
      Parameters:
      btn - integer number assigned to a mouse button in glfw
      Returns:
      true if a mouse button is pressed, false else

    • isMouseDown

      public static boolean isMouseDown​(int btn)
      This function checks if a mouse button is being held down, returns true if it is, false if not
      Parameters:
      btn - integer number assigned to a mouse button in glfw
      Returns:
      true if mouse button is held down, false else

    • isMouseUp

      public static boolean isMouseUp​(int btn)
      This function checks if a mouse button was released, returns true if it is, false if not
      Parameters:
      btn - integer number assigned to a mouse button in glfw
      Returns:
      true if mouse button was released, false else

    • resetKeyboard

      public static void resetKeyboard()

    • update

      public static void update()
      This function resets both the keyboard keys and the mouse buttons

    • getMousePos

      public static Vector2f getMousePos()
      Getter, this function returns the x and y coordinates of the mouse on the screen
      Returns:
      a 2 float vector containing x and y coordinates of the mouse onscreen, first element in the vector - X, second element - Y
